author: Simon Rice
title: Real Madrid target Chelsea duo Eden Hazard and Thibaut Courtois this summer
text:
Eden Hazard has been superb in Antonio Conte’s Chelsea side (Getty) Real Madrid are planning an audacious swoop for Chelsea forward Eden Hazard – and may try to snatch Thibaut Courtois too, according to reports.
The Guardian claim that the Spanish giants have hatched a plan to steal Hazard away from Stamford Bridge.
Man Utd 'on verge' of sealing £86m signing to delight Mourinho It’s claim that Real Madrid have already made contact with the Belgian’s camp in a bid to start making some progress with pushing a move through.
Hazard has three years remaining on his contract at Chelsea and has appeared highly content at Stamford Bridge. However Real Madrid believe he can be convinced to join them.
They will give him assurances over a starting place in the side, believing that Hazard and their current attacking stars are compatible. It could see Zinedine Zidane’s side lining up with Cristiano Ronaldo, Karim Benzema, Gareth Bale and Hazard all in the same starting XI. They will also push on Hazard the Galactico status he will awarded by moving to the Bernabeu.
Eden Hazard could be in the same team as Gareth Bale next season (Getty) Real Madrid are open to selling James Rodriguez and Alvaro Morata– with the latter potentially being used in a part exchange deal. Antonio Conte is known to be a fan.
They may also move for his team-mate Courtois. The Guardian claim that Real Madrid fear they may not be able to prise top goalkeeping target David De Gea away from Manchester United and have turned their attention to the Chelsea stopper.
